00204 /**
00205  * cvmx_ndf_bt_pg_info
00206  *
00207  * This register provides the page size and the number of column-plus-row address-cycle
00208  * information. Software writes to this register during a boot operation from a NAND flash
00209  * device.
00210  *
00211  * Additionally, software also writes the multiplier value for timing parameters that is used
00212  * during the boot process, in the SET_TM_PARAM command. The multiplier value is used only by the
00213  * boot-load state machine during boot operations. Boot DMA operations do not use this value.
00214  *
00215  * Sixty-four-bit operations must be used to access this register.
00216  */
00217 union cvmx_ndf_bt_pg_info {
00218     uint64_t u64;
00219     struct cvmx_ndf_bt_pg_info_s {
00220 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00221     uint64_t reserved_11_63               : 53;
00222     uint64_t t_mult                       : 4;  /**< The boot-time TIM_MULT field of the SET_TM_PAR command. */
00223     uint64_t adr_cyc                      : 4;  /**< Number of column-address cycles. Legal values are 0x3 - 0x8. Values written to this field
00224                                                          smaller than 0x3 are converted to 0x3; values larger than 0x8 are converted to 0x8. */
00225     uint64_t size                         : 3;  /**< Number of bytes per page in the NAND flash device = 2^SIZE+1 * 256.
00226                                                          0x0 = 512 bytes/page.
00227                                                          0x1 = 1 KB/page.
00228                                                          0x2 = 2 KB/page.
00229                                                          0x3 = 4 KB/page.
00230                                                          0x4 = 8 KB/page.
00231                                                          0x5 = 16 KB/page.
00232                                                          0x6 = 32 KB/page.
00233                                                          0x7 = 64 KB/page. */
00234 #else
00235     uint64_t size                         : 3;
00236     uint64_t adr_cyc                      : 4;
00237     uint64_t t_mult                       : 4;
00238     uint64_t reserved_11_63               : 53;
00239 #endif
00240     } s;

00254 /**
00255  * cvmx_ndf_cmd
00256  *
00257  * When software reads this register, NDF_MISC[RD_VAL] is cleared to 0. Software must always
00258  * write all eight bytes whenever it writes this register. If there are fewer than eight bytes
00259  * left in the command sequence that software wants the NAND flash controller to execute, it must
00260  * insert Idle (WAIT) commands to make up eight bytes. Software must also ensure that there is
00261  * enough space in the NDF_CMD queue to accept these eight bytes by first reading
00262  * NDF_MISC[FR_BYT].
00263  *
00264  * Sixty-four-bit operations must be used to access this register.
00265  */
00266 union cvmx_ndf_cmd {
00267     uint64_t u64;
00268     struct cvmx_ndf_cmd_s {
00269 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00270     uint64_t nf_cmd                       : 64; /**< Eight NAND flash memory command bytes. */
00271 #else
00272     uint64_t nf_cmd                       : 64;
00273 #endif
00274     } s;
00275     struct cvmx_ndf_cmd_s                 cn52xx;
00276     struct cvmx_ndf_cmd_s                 cn63xx;
00277     struct cvmx_ndf_cmd_s                 cn63xxp1;
00278     struct cvmx_ndf_cmd_s                 cn66xx;
00279     struct cvmx_ndf_cmd_s                 cn68xx;
00280     struct cvmx_ndf_cmd_s                 cn68xxp1;
00281     struct cvmx_ndf_cmd_s                 cn70xx;

00353 /**
00354  * cvmx_ndf_drbell
00355  *
00356  * This register is designed to control the execution of the NAND flash commands. The NDF
00357  * command-execution unit must arbitrate for the boot bus before it can enable a NAND flash
00358  * device connected to the CNXXXX, which it then does by asserting the device's chip-enable
00359  * signal. Therefore software must first load the NDF_CMD queue, with a full sequence of commands
00360  * to perform a NAND flash device task.
00361  *
00362  * This command sequence starts with a BUS_ACQ command, and the last command in the sequence must
00363  * be a BUS_REL command. The execution unit starts execution of the sequence only if the
00364  * NDF_DRBELL[CNT] is nonzero when it fetches the BUS_ACQ command.
00365  *
00366  * Software can load multiple such sequences, each starting with a CHIP_EN command and ending
00367  * with a CHIP_DIS command, and then write a data value to this register to increment the CNT
00368  * field by the number of the command sequences loaded to the NDF_CMD queue.
00369  *
00370  * Software register-write operations increment CNT by the signed 8-bit value being written.
00371  * Software register-read operations return the current CNT value.
00372  *
00373  * Hardware can also modifies the value of CNT. Every time hardware executes a BUS_ACQ command to
00374  * arbitrate and win the boot bus, it decrements CNT by 1. If CNT is already 0 or negative, the
00375  * hardware command-execution unit stalls when it fetches the new BUS_ACQ command from the
00376  * NDF_CMD queue. Only when the software writes to this register with a nonzero data value can
00377  * the execution unit come out of the stalled condition, and resume execution.
00378  *
00379  * Sixty-four-bit operations must be used to access this register.
00380  */
00381 union cvmx_ndf_drbell {
00382     uint64_t u64;
00383     struct cvmx_ndf_drbell_s {
00384 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00385     uint64_t reserved_8_63                : 56;
00386     uint64_t cnt                          : 8;  /**< Doorbell count, in 2s-complement format. */
00387 #else
00388     uint64_t cnt                          : 8;
00389     uint64_t reserved_8_63                : 56;
00390 #endif
00391     } s;
00392     struct cvmx_ndf_drbell_s              cn52xx;
00393     struct cvmx_ndf_drbell_s              cn63xx;
00394     struct cvmx_ndf_drbell_s              cn63xxp1;
00395     struct cvmx_ndf_drbell_s              cn66xx;
00396     struct cvmx_ndf_drbell_s              cn68xx;
00397     struct cvmx_ndf_drbell_s              cn68xxp1;
00398     struct cvmx_ndf_drbell_s              cn70xx;
00399     struct cvmx_ndf_drbell_s              cn70xxp1;
00400     struct cvmx_ndf_drbell_s              cn73xx;
00401     struct cvmx_ndf_drbell_s              cnf75xx;
00402 };
00403 typedef union cvmx_ndf_drbell cvmx_ndf_drbell_t;
00404

00411 union cvmx_ndf_ecc_cnt {
00412     uint64_t u64;
00413     struct cvmx_ndf_ecc_cnt_s {
00414 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00415     uint64_t reserved_32_63               : 32;
00416     uint64_t xor_ecc                      : 24; /**< Result of XOR operation of ECC read bytes and ECC generated bytes. The value pertains to
00417                                                          the last single-bit ECC error.
00418                                                          _ XOR_ECC =[ECC_gen_byt258, ECC_gen_byt257, ECC_gen_byt256] ^
00419                                                            [ECC_258, ECC_257, ECC_256]
00420                                                          ECC_258, ECC_257 and ECC_256 are bytes stored in the NAND flash device and read out during
00421                                                          boot.
00422                                                          ECC_gen_byt258, ECC_gen_byt257, ECC_gen_byt256 are generated from data read out from the
00423                                                          NAND flash device. */
00424     uint64_t ecc_err                      : 8;  /**< ECC error count. The number of single-bit errors fixed during boot. */
00425 #else
00426     uint64_t ecc_err                      : 8;
00427     uint64_t xor_ecc                      : 24;
00428     uint64_t reserved_32_63               : 32;
00429 #endif
00430     } s;
00431     struct cvmx_ndf_ecc_cnt_s             cn52xx;
00432     struct cvmx_ndf_ecc_cnt_s             cn63xx;
00433     struct cvmx_ndf_ecc_cnt_s             cn63xxp1;
00434     struct cvmx_ndf_ecc_cnt_s             cn66xx;
00435     struct cvmx_ndf_ecc_cnt_s             cn68xx;
00436     struct cvmx_ndf_ecc_cnt_s             cn68xxp1;
00437     struct cvmx_ndf_ecc_cnt_s             cn70xx;
00438     struct cvmx_ndf_ecc_cnt_s             cn70xxp1;
00439     struct cvmx_ndf_ecc_cnt_s             cn73xx;
00440     struct cvmx_ndf_ecc_cnt_s             cnf75xx;
00441 };

00444 /**
00445  * cvmx_ndf_int
00446  *
00447  * This register contains the bits that can trigger an error interrupt. Sixty-four-bit operations
00448  * must be used to access this register.
00449  */
00450 union cvmx_ndf_int {
00451     uint64_t u64;
00452     struct cvmx_ndf_int_s {
00453 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00454     uint64_t reserved_8_63                : 56;
00455     uint64_t dma_done                     : 1;  /**< DMA engine request completion interrupt. */
00456     uint64_t ovrf                         : 1;  /**< NDF_CMD write when FIFO is full. Generally a fatal error. */
00457     uint64_t ecc_mult                     : 1;  /**< Multibit ECC error detected during boot. */
00458     uint64_t ecc_1bit                     : 1;  /**< Single-bit ECC error detected and fixed during boot. */
00459     uint64_t sm_bad                       : 1;  /**< One of the state machines is in a bad state, */
00460     uint64_t wdog                         : 1;  /**< Watchdog timer expired during command execution. */
00461     uint64_t full                         : 1;  /**< NDF_CMD queue is full. FULL status is updated when the NDF_CMD queue becomes full as a
00462                                                          result of software writing a new command to it. */
00463     uint64_t empty                        : 1;  /**< NDF_CMD queue is empty. EMPTY status is updated when the NDF_CMD queue becomes empty as a
00464                                                          result of command execution unit fetching the last instruction out of the NDF_CMD queue. */
00465 #else
00466     uint64_t empty                        : 1;
00467     uint64_t full                         : 1;
00468     uint64_t wdog                         : 1;
00469     uint64_t sm_bad                       : 1;
00470     uint64_t ecc_1bit                     : 1;
00471     uint64_t ecc_mult                     : 1;
00472     uint64_t ovrf                         : 1;
00473     uint64_t dma_done                     : 1;
00474     uint64_t reserved_8_63                : 56;
00475 #endif
00476     } s;
00477     struct cvmx_ndf_int_cn52xx {
00478 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00479     uint64_t reserved_7_63                : 57;
00480     uint64_t ovrf                         : 1;  /**< NDF_CMD write when fifo is full. Generally a
00481                                                          fatal error. */
00482     uint64_t ecc_mult                     : 1;  /**< Multi bit ECC error detected during boot */
00483     uint64_t ecc_1bit                     : 1;  /**< Single bit ECC error detected and fixed during boot */
00484     uint64_t sm_bad                       : 1;  /**< One of the state machines in a bad state */
00485     uint64_t wdog                         : 1;  /**< Watch Dog timer expired during command execution */
00486     uint64_t full                         : 1;  /**< Command fifo is full */
00487     uint64_t empty                        : 1;  /**< Command fifo is empty */
00488 #else
00489     uint64_t empty                        : 1;
00490     uint64_t full                         : 1;
00491     uint64_t wdog                         : 1;
00492     uint64_t sm_bad                       : 1;
00493     uint64_t ecc_1bit                     : 1;
00494     uint64_t ecc_mult                     : 1;

00496     uint64_t reserved_7_63                : 57;
00497 #endif
00498     } cn52xx;

00587 /**
00588  * cvmx_ndf_misc
00589  *
00590  * Sixty-four-bit operations must be used to access this register.
00591  *
00592  */
00593 union cvmx_ndf_misc {
00594     uint64_t u64;
00595     struct cvmx_ndf_misc_s {
00596 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00597     uint64_t reserved_28_63               : 36;
00598     uint64_t mb_dis                       : 1;  /**< Set to disable multi-bit error hangs. Allows boot loads and boot DMAs to proceed as if no
00599                                                          multi-bit errors occurred. Hardware fixes single bit errors as usual. */
00600     uint64_t nbr_hwm                      : 3;  /**< High watermark for NBR FIFO or load/store operations. Specifies the high
00601                                                          watermark for the IOI outbound load/store commands receive FIFO. NBR_HWM+1 is used
00602                                                          as the high watermark.  So a value of 0 allows 1 entry in the FIFO at a time.  The
00603                                                          FIFO size is 8 entries. */
00604     uint64_t wait_cnt                     : 6;  /**< Wait input filter count. Represents the number of coprocessor-clock cycles for glitch
00605                                                          filtering of BOOT_WAIT_L from the NAND flash device. */
00606     uint64_t fr_byt                       : 11; /**< Unfilled NDF_CMD queue bytes. Specifies the number of unfilled bytes in the
00607                                                          NDF_CMD queue. Bytes become unfilled as commands complete execution and exit. (FIFO is 256
00608                                                          bytes when BT_DIS = 0 and 1536 bytes when BT_DIS = 1.) */
00609     uint64_t rd_done                      : 1;  /**< Read done. This bit is set to 1 by hardware when it reads the last eight bytes out of the
00610                                                          NDF_CMD queue in response to RD_CMD being set to 1 by software. */
00611     uint64_t rd_val                       : 1;  /**< This read-only bit is set to 1 by hardware when it reads the next eight bytes from NDF_CMD
00612                                                          queue in response to RD_CMD being set to 1. A software read of NDF_CMD clears this bit to
00613                                                          0. */
00614     uint64_t rd_cmd                       : 1;  /**< Read command. When set to 1, the hardware reads the contents of the NDF_CMD queue eight
00615                                                          bytes at a time and places the data into NDF_CMD. Software should first read RD_VAL to see
00616                                                          if the next eight bytes from the NDF_CMD queue are available in NDF_CMD.
00617                                                          All NDF_CMD queue read operations start and end on an eight-byte boundary. A RD_CMD
00618                                                          command in the middle of command execution causes the execution to freeze until RD_DONE is
00619                                                          set to 1.
00620                                                          This bit is cleared on any NDF_CMD software write command. */
00621     uint64_t bt_dma                       : 1;  /**< Boot-time DMA enable. When set to 1, boot-time DMA is enabled. This indicates to the NAND
00622                                                          flash boot-control state machine that boot DMA read operations can begin. Software should
00623                                                          set this bit to 1 after loading the NDF_CMD queue. Hardware sets the bit to 0 when boot
00624                                                          DMA command execution is complete. If chip-enable 0 is not a NAND flash device, this bit
00625                                                          is permanently 0 with software write operations ignored.
00626                                                          When [BT_DIS] = 1, this bit is 0. */
00627     uint64_t bt_dis                       : 1;  /**< Boot disable. When the boot operation is over, software must set this field to 1, which
00628                                                          causes the boot-control state machines to sleep.
00629                                                          This bit indicates to the NAND flash boot-control state machine that boot operation has
00630                                                          ended. When this bit changes from 0 -> 1, the NDF_CMD queue is emptied as a side effect.
00631                                                          This bit must never be set when booting from NAND flash and region zero is enabled. */
00632     uint64_t ex_dis                       : 1;  /**< Execution disable. When set to 1, this bit stops command execution after completing the
00633                                                          execution of all commands currently in the NDF_CMD queue. Once command execution has
00634                                                          stopped and then new commands are loaded into the NDF_CMD queue, command execution does
00635                                                          not resume while this bit is 1.
00636                                                          When this bit is set to 0, execution resumes if the NDF_CMD queue is not empty. */
00637     uint64_t rst_ff                       : 1;  /**< Reset FIFO.
00638                                                          0 = Normal operation.
00639                                                          1 = Reset NDF_CMD queue to empty it; any command in flight is not aborted before
00640                                                          resetting. The FIFO comes up empty at the end of power on reset. */
00641 #else
00642     uint64_t rst_ff                       : 1;
00643     uint64_t ex_dis                       : 1;
00644     uint64_t bt_dis                       : 1;
00645     uint64_t bt_dma                       : 1;
00646     uint64_t rd_cmd                       : 1;
00647     uint64_t rd_val                       : 1;
00648     uint64_t rd_done                      : 1;
00649     uint64_t fr_byt                       : 11;
00650     uint64_t wait_cnt                     : 6;
00651     uint64_t nbr_hwm                      : 3;
00652     uint64_t mb_dis                       : 1;
00653     uint64_t reserved_28_63               : 36;
00654 #endif
00655     } s;
00656     struct cvmx_ndf_misc_cn52xx {
00657 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00658     uint64_t reserved_27_63               : 37;
00659     uint64_t nbr_hwm                      : 3;  /**< Hi Water mark for NBR fifo or load/stores */
00660     uint64_t wait_cnt                     : 6;  /**< WAIT input filter count */
00661     uint64_t fr_byt                       : 11; /**< Number of unfilled Command fifo bytes */
00662     uint64_t rd_done                      : 1;  /**< This W1C bit is set to 1 by HW when it completes
00663                                                          command fifo read out, in response to RD_CMD */
00664     uint64_t rd_val                       : 1;  /**< This RO bit is set to 1 by HW when it reads next 8
00665                                                          bytes from Command fifo into the NDF_CMD csr
00666                                                          SW reads NDF_CMD csr, HW clears this bit to 0 */
00667     uint64_t rd_cmd                       : 1;  /**< When 1, HW reads out contents of the Command fifo 8
00668                                                          bytes at a time into the NDF_CMD csr */
00669     uint64_t bt_dma                       : 1;  /**< When set to 1, boot time dma is enabled */
00670     uint64_t bt_dis                       : 1;  /**< When boot operation is over SW must set to 1
00671                                                          causes boot state mchines to sleep */
00672     uint64_t ex_dis                       : 1;  /**< When set to 1, suspends execution of commands at
00673                                                          next command in the fifo. */
00674     uint64_t rst_ff                       : 1;  /**< 1=reset command fifo to make it empty,
00675                                                          0=normal operation */
00676 #else
00677     uint64_t rst_ff                       : 1;
00678     uint64_t ex_dis                       : 1;
00679     uint64_t bt_dis                       : 1;
00680     uint64_t bt_dma                       : 1;
00681     uint64_t rd_cmd                       : 1;
00682     uint64_t rd_val                       : 1;
00683     uint64_t rd_done                      : 1;
00684     uint64_t fr_byt                       : 11;
00685     uint64_t wait_cnt                     : 6;
00686     uint64_t nbr_hwm                      : 3;
00687     uint64_t reserved_27_63               : 37;
00688 #endif
00689     } cn52xx;
00690     struct cvmx_ndf_misc_s                cn63xx;
00691     struct cvmx_ndf_misc_s                cn63xxp1;
00692     struct cvmx_ndf_misc_s                cn66xx;
00693     struct cvmx_ndf_misc_s                cn68xx;
00694     struct cvmx_ndf_misc_s                cn68xxp1;
00695     struct cvmx_ndf_misc_s                cn70xx;
00696     struct cvmx_ndf_misc_s                cn70xxp1;
00697     struct cvmx_ndf_misc_s                cn73xx;
00698     struct cvmx_ndf_misc_s                cnf75xx;
00699 };

00708 union cvmx_ndf_st_reg {

00717     uint64_t bt_sm                        : 4;  /**< Boot-load and boot-DMA state-machine states. */

00719     uint64_t rd_ff                        : 2;  /**< NDF_CMD-queue read-back state machine states. */
00720     uint64_t main_bad                     : 1;  /**< The main state machine is in a 'bad' state. */
00721     uint64_t main_sm                      : 3;  /**< Main state machine states. */
00722 #else

00726     uint64_t rd_ff_bad                    : 1;
00727     uint64_t bt_sm                        : 4;
00728     uint64_t exe_sm                       : 4;
00729     uint64_t exe_idle                     : 1;
00730     uint64_t reserved_16_63               : 48;
00731 #endif
00732     } s;
